topics.body:
So my Armenian friend is pleased.
Turkey is 20% Kurdish and the Kurds outbreed the native Turks.

So guess that he hopes happens?

To be fair the Kurds are pretty cool people. Iraqi Kurdistan was an oasis of peace and prosperity. And the Christians who live there are not attacked for being Christian.
And the Syrian Kurds have broken off from the rest of the country and have done a good job keeping out Al Qaeda.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body: Syrian Kurds I think are cool with Assad. Though I suspect they wouldn't mind "these moderates":http://youtu.be/sSiUWPAdSWw, who are winning now ISIS has gone the other way.

[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532f8506636872487e120100#post_532f8506636872487e120100
The reason for that is both sides have entire battalions of lawyers. Effectively it is a microcosm of the current geopolitical landscape, where you only attack people not capable of retaliating in any meaningful way.[/bq]
Attacking people that have no way of fighting back is boring and pointless.

topics.body:
After playing through ghosts and goblins I think I've realized what makes a game good whereas other games total shitake mushrooms.

Ghosts and goblins and a ton of nearly impossible games are hard and make people rage, but they're fair.  Ghosts and goblins the only time it does something that's total bs is when how weak the shield is and you can avoid it.  If I die in say ghosts and goblins, contra or dark souls I know it's cause I fucked up and not cause a lot of games just didn't care about testing their game first.  They don't have a failsafe "Oh you're too good at playing this game so we're going to knock you down a peg" button or a failsafe "Oh they have too much health, better spawn a enemy right on top of him out of thin air to take 90% of his health so the game is harder" button.

On the other hand if you spawn 50 enemies out of thin air on top of a character and they take out 99% of your health and you have no way of defending yourself as your keyboard input is temporarily disabled by the game and then you have to go fight a hundreds of enemies all at once with only 1 hp left just cause the game thinks you're playing too well that's going to piss off a lot of people.

(yes I did just play ghosts and goblins today for 8 hours)
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532fe1f56368724ae20e0000#post_532fe1f56368724ae20e0000
I've played Ghosts and Goblins before, I've beaten it too, My Thumbs hurt for months
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532fe42863687211e60a0000#post_532fe42863687211e60a0000
Git gud :V
But in all seriousness I know how you feel.

It's been a while since I've played a game this hard.  99.99% of the time when a game claims to be difficult what they really means is "on occasion if your health is too high or you haven't died we'll just occasionally spawn enemies out of thin air to take away your health".

Games should not punish a player for being too skilled and unfortunately far too many now are punishing skilled players to give the illusion that their games are more difficult than they actually are.  What I mean by this is let's use a analogy; if you play fps games have you ever had a occasion where enemies spawn right out of thin air in front of your face then blows you to paste?  That's not a glitch, that's intentional.

*. . .* You know what?  I'm going to play ghosts and goblins again.  It's been a while since I've felt this good after completing a game.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532fe89863687211e6530100#post_532fe89863687211e6530100
Difficulty, imo, is only fun in games which have really great gameplay.
So games like Skyrim or the Bethesda Fallouts, no thank you. Because in both games, the added difficulty just makes the enemies have more health and/or do more damage. Add on top of that the barebones gameplay and you get a fairly unrewarding experience.

Seriously I just did a lot of Fallout 3 on Very Hard, I just ended up using a lot of bullets.


Also, quicksaving can be a bad habit.
